title: First Step
text: First, multiply each entry of row $$2$$ by $$3$$. The result is $$\begin{bmatrix} 4 & -6 & -3 \\ 9 & 6 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$$
speech: First, multiply each entry of row  2  by  3 . The result is  the 2 by 3 matrix row 1 4, negative 6, negative 3 row 2 9, 6, 3
pacedSpeech: First, multiply each entry of row   2
. The result is   the 2 by 3 matrix row 1 4, negative 6, negative 3 row 2 9, 6, 3

title: Second Step
text: Then, add each entry of row $$1$$ to the entry in the same column of row $$2$$. (Row $$1$$, meanwhile, remains unchanged.) The answer is $$\begin{bmatrix} 4 & -6 & -3 \\ 13 & 0 & 0 \end{bmatrix}$$
speech: Then, add each entry of row  1  to the entry in the same column of row  2 . (Row  1 , meanwhile, remains unchanged.) The answer is  the 2 by 3 matrix row 1 4, negative 6, negative 3 row 2 13, 0, 0

to the entry in the same column of row   2
, meanwhile, remains unchanged.) The answer is   the 2 by 3 matrix row 1 4, negative 6, negative 3 row 2 13, 0, 0
